Create image thumbnails

Source: R/uas_thumbnails_make.R
uas_thumbnails_make.Rd

Move UAS images into sub-directories by group

uas_thumbnails_make(
  x,
  img_dir = NULL,
  output_dir = NULL,
  tb_width = 400,
  overwrite = FALSE,
  use_magick = FALSE,
  quiet = FALSE
)

Arguments

x

A list of class 'uas_info'
img_dir

Image folders in x to process (NULL to process all)
output_dir

Output directory
tb_width

Thumbnail width
overwrite

Overwrite existing files
use_magick

Use the ImageMagick command line tool
quiet

Suppress messages

Value

A named list (one element for each directory processed) of thumbnail files created in the output directory

Details

This will create thumbnail images for the drone images in x. img_dir allows you to specify a subset of folders in x to process. The default output folder is a sub-directory of each image folder called map/tb, which will be created if needed. This location can be overridden with output_dir. The dimensions of the thumbnails is determined by tb_width, from which the height is set automatically.

Thumbnail files will be given an 8-character suffix that looks random but is actually generated from the image contents. This is to prevent clashes when thumnbail files from different flights are 'gathered' into a single folder attached to a Table of Contents folder (see uas_toc).

If use_magick = TRUE, the function will create the thumbnail images using the ImageMagick command line tool (magick.exe). This is a slightly faster way to generate thumbnails, which may help when you're creating thumbnails for 1000s of images. However you don't get the benefit of a progress bar. This option requires you to have ImageMagick installed. When installing the software, be sure to check the box that says 'Add application directory to your system path'. Note you'll have to restart RStudio after you install ImageMagick. You can test whether the command line tool is available to R by running findonpath("magick.exe") (MacOS users should omit the .exe extension).

See also

uas_report
